name.text: 001 Watch the video:The Flipped Classroom, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

questiontext.text: Watch the video:The Flipped Classroom, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

name.text: 002 True or False: CSSE 120 uses a flipped learning approach.

questiontext.text: True or False: CSSE 120 uses a flipped learning approach.

name.text: 003 In a flipped classroom, the deep learning occurs:

questiontext.text: In a flipped classroom, the deep learning occurs:

name.text: 004 True or False: In CSSE120, before most sessions you will watch some short videos and/or do some reading, plus do a short quiz to help you digest the main ideas from the videos/reading.

questiontext.text: True or False: In CSSE120, before most sessions you will watch some short videos and/or do some reading, plus do a short quiz to help you digest the main ideas from the videos/reading.

name.text: 005 You should do the quiz:

questiontext.text: You should do the quiz:

answer.text: Before you watch the associated videos and/or do the reading.
While you are watching the associated videos and/or doing the reading.
After you watch the associated videos and/or do the reading.
Your choice — any of the answers are fine, although many students will do best answering questions while watching the videos and/or doing the reading.

name.text: 006 What should you do if there are questions in the quiz whose answer you don't know?

questiontext.text: What should you do if there are questions in the quiz whose answer you don't know?

answer.text: Leave the question(s) blank and ask about them at the beginning of class.

name.text: 007 If you don't watch the video and do the quiz before class, should you come to class anyhow?

questiontext.text: If you don't watch the video and do the quiz before class, should you come to class anyhow?

name.text: 008 Is it appropriate to NOT do the video until class, and then ask your professor (or an assistant or classmate) for the answers to all the questions?

questiontext.text: Is it appropriate to NOT do the video until class, and then ask your professor (or an assistant or classmate) for the answers to all the questions?

name.text: 009 True or False: Before you begin the in-class exercises for a session, you must do the quiz (and hence its associated videos/reading) for that session, even if that means doing the quiz at the beginning of a session. That is, your quiz is your admission ticket for doing the in-class exercises.

questiontext.text: True or False: Before you begin the in-class exercises for a session, you must do the quiz (and hence its associated videos/reading) for that session, even if that means doing the quiz at the beginning of a session. That is, your quiz is your admission ticket for doing the in-class exercises.

name.text: 010 Watch the video: What is Software Engineering?, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

questiontext.text: Watch the video: What is Software Engineering?, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

name.text: 011 What is the name of the programming language that we will use in this course?

questiontext.text: What is the name of the programming language that we will use in this course?

name.text: 012 True or False: The programming language for our course is mostly used to teach beginners how to program.

questiontext.text: True or False: The programming language for our course is mostly used to teach beginners how to program.

name.text: 013 True or False: Many software engineers see themselves as an artist who creates beautiful artifacts, much as a painter or musician would.

questiontext.text: True or False: Many software engineers see themselves as an artist who creates beautiful artifacts, much as a painter or musician would.

name.text: 014 This course focuses on:

questiontext.text: This course focuses on:

answer.text: The subset of software engineering called software development.

name.text: 015 True or False: Learning techniques that scale up to software development of real-world, large programs is an important goal of this course.

questiontext.text: True or False: Learning techniques that scale up to software development of real-world, large programs is an important goal of this course.

name.text: 016 True or False: Software engineers rarely interact with other people when doing their job well.

questiontext.text: True or False: Software engineers rarely interact with other people when doing their job well.

name.text: 017 A typical software engineer spends most of her time typing lines in a program.

questiontext.text: A typical software engineer spends most of her time typing lines in a program.

name.text: 018 Men are usually better software engineers than women are.

questiontext.text: Men are usually better software engineers than women are.

name.text: 019 Software engineering requires being a creative thinker.

questiontext.text: Software engineering requires being a creative thinker.

name.text: 020 Watch the video: Your First Programs, Part 1: Comments, Strings and the PRINT function, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

questiontext.text: Watch the video: Your First Programs, Part 1: Comments, Strings and the PRINT function, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

name.text: 021 You should expect to master the material of this video:

questiontext.text: You should expect to master the material of this video:

answer.text: From the video PLUS the exercises you do in class that reinforce the ideas of this video.

name.text: 022 Files with Python code are called:

questiontext.text: Files with Python code are called:

name.text: 023 True or False: In each class session, you work through the “m” files (that is, the ones whose names begin with “m”) in the order in which they are numbered.

questiontext.text: True or False: In each class session, you work through the “m” files (that is, the ones whose names begin with “m”) in the order in which they are numbered.

name.text: 024 Which of the following is a Python comment?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a Python comment?

answer.text: # TODO: Write a program that makes people laugh.

name.text: 025 Check each of the following that is a string.

questiontext.text: Check each of the following that is a string.

name.text:
026 What appears on the console when the following statement runs? (If nothing, write nothing.) 
  print('one')

questiontext.text:
What appears on the console when the following statement runs? (If nothing, write nothing.) 
  print('one')

What appears on the console when the following statement runs? (If nothing, write nothing.)

028 What appears on the console when the following statement runs? (If nothing, write nothing.) 
   print(2 + 2)

What appears on the console when the following statement runs? (If nothing, write nothing.)

questiontext.text:
What appears on the console when the following statement runs? (If nothing, write nothing.) 
   print('2 + 2')

030 What appears on the console when the following statement runs? (If nothing, write nothing.)

What appears on the console when the following statement runs? (If nothing, write nothing.)

What appears on the console when the following statement runs? (If nothing, write nothing.) 
   print('4, 9')

name.text: 032 A function in Python is:

questiontext.text: A function in Python is:

answer.text: A chunk of code that has a NAME.

name.text: 033 Suppose that a program has defined a function whose name is write_to_file. Suppose further that this function takes a single string and writes the string to a file. Which of the following is a correct notation for CALLING that function?

questiontext.text: Suppose that a program has defined a function whose name is write_to_file. Suppose further that this function takes a single string and writes the string to a file. Which of the following is a correct notation for CALLING that function?

name.text: 034 Suppose that a program has defined a function whose name is insult. Suppose further that this function takes no argument and prints a randomly chosen insult on the console. Which of the following is a correct notation for CALLING that function?

questiontext.text: Suppose that a program has defined a function whose name is insult. Suppose further that this function takes no argument and prints a randomly chosen insult on the console. Which of the following is a correct notation for CALLING that function?

name.text: 035 Watch the video: Your First Programs, Part 2: Hello World — YOUR first program, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

questiontext.text: Watch the video: Your First Programs, Part 2: Hello World — YOUR first program, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

name.text: 036 Each session, in class you should:

questiontext.text: Each session, in class you should:

answer.text: Check out the project for the session and go through the modules whose name begins with an “m”, in the order that they are numbered.

name.text: 037 Put a checkmark beside each of the following modules that is an EXAMPLE module.

questiontext.text: Put a checkmark beside each of the following modules that is an EXAMPLE module.

name.text: 038 When you do an EXAMPLE module, you should:

questiontext.text: When you do an EXAMPLE module, you should:

answer.text: Study the module for at least 10 minutes.
Skip the module and come back to it later as needed.
Run the module (so you know what it does) and at least skim the code (so that you know what examples it has).

name.text: 039 When you do a module that is NOT an example module, you should:

questiontext.text: When you do a module that is NOT an example module, you should:

answer.text: Do whatever the TODOs in the module tell you to do.

name.text: 040 In this course, the instructions for what to do in class are:

questiontext.text: In this course, the instructions for what to do in class are:

answer.text: Handed out on paper at the beginning of class.
In a file reachable from the session's Preparation page.
Inside each of the non-example modules, at the TODOs in the modules.

name.text: 041 In this course, you turn in your in-class work by COMMITTING the modules that you modify. You should commit (i.e,. turn in your work):

questiontext.text: In this course, you turn in your in-class work by COMMITTING the modules that you modify. You should commit (i.e,. turn in your work):

answer.text: As often as you want, but at least as you complete each module and at the end of the session.
However many times your instructor tells you to.
However many times your inner child tells you to.

name.text: 042 If you are fuzzy on ANY of the ideas in these videos at this point, you should:

questiontext.text: If you are fuzzy on ANY of the ideas in these videos at this point, you should:

answer.text: Not worry, because there will be lots of people in class who will help you with the modules during Session 1.

questiontext.text: Watch the video: Your First Programs, Part 3: Introduction to Objects, via Turtle Graphics, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

questiontext.text: You should expect to master the material of this video:

answer.text: From the video PLUS the exercises you do in class (asking questions during class as needed).

questiontext.text: Which of the following makes the name crow have the value 'black'.

name.text: 048 If you have any troubles or get error messages when doing the m3 exercise during Session 1, you should:

questiontext.text: If you have any troubles or get error messages when doing the m3 exercise during Session 1, you should:

answer.text: Keep working on the problem by yourself until you fix the error.
Be quick to ask for help.

name.text: 049 Watch the video: Your First Programs, Part 4: Functions, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

questiontext.text: Watch the video: Your First Programs, Part 4: Functions, doing the next set of questions while you do so.

name.text: 050 A function in Python is:

questiontext.text: A function in Python is:

answer.text: A chunk of code that has a NAME.

name.text:
051 Consider the following program. What does it print when it runs?
def main():
    foo()
    foo()
def foo():
    print('hi')
main()

questiontext.text:
Consider the following program. What does it print when it runs?
def main():
    foo()
    foo()
def foo():
    print('hi')
main()

name.text:
052 This question is tricky and MUCH too difficult. But we thought you might like to think about it. Here is the question: What happens when the following code runs?
def main()
    print('ok')
    main()

main()

questiontext.text:
This question is tricky and MUCH too difficult. But we thought you might like to think about it. Here is the question: What happens when the following code runs?
def main()
    print('ok')
    main()

main()

answer.text: Just select this answer to indicate that you thought about this question briefly. (You get full credit just for selecting this answer.)
Do NOT select this answer! (Moodle won't let me give just one choice...)
